intro: Ricinocarpus villosus var. racemosus, commonly known as the hairy ricinocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, pale green flowers arranged in racemose inflorescences, which are typically borne on elongated stalks. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. This species is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in moist, shaded environments.
